ManualEntry.Stage1CalloutTitle: Stage 1: Enter asset and file details
ManualEntry.Stage1CalloutDescription: Asset ID and file URL are mandatory for every row. Other metadata is optional and can be refined later.
ManualEntry.Stage1CalloutSkip: You can choose file types in Stage 2 or skip that step by selecting "Proceed Without Selecting File Types".
ManualEntry.FileTypesHint: These values come from your institution's Asset File Type configuration.
ManualEntry.Stage2Description: Select the appropriate file type for each entry. These IDs are required by the Esploro API.

Hints.FileUrl: Provide the fully qualified URL that Esploro can fetch.

Errors.AssetIdInvalid: Asset ID not found in Esploro.

Upload.Title: Upload CSV File
Upload.Subtitle: Bulk process asset files from CSV data
Upload.DragDrop: Drag and drop your CSV file here

Requirements.Title: File Requirements:
Requirements.Headers: First row must contain column headers

Mapping.Title: Map CSV Columns
Mapping.Subtitle: Associate your CSV columns with the required fields. Only MMS ID and Remote URL must be mapped; all other columns are optional.
Mapping.RequiredFieldsNote: MMS ID and Remote URL must be present. Other metadata can be left unmapped or added later.

FileTypeConversion.Title: File Type Validation & Conversion
FileTypeConversion.Subtitle: Convert file type names to valid category IDs
FileTypeConversion.Explanation: The file type values in your CSV appear to be names (target_code) rather than the required ID values. The system will attempt to match them with valid file type categories from the AssetFileAndLinkTypes mapping table.
FileTypeConversion.Note: Note: The ID value must be used in API calls, not the name.
FileTypeConversion.SummaryDetails: {total} unique {total, plural, =1 {value} other {values}} found: {auto} automatically matched, {manual} require manual selection
FileTypeConversion.UnresolvedListIntro: The following {count, plural, =1 {value requires} other {values require}} manual file type selection:

FileType.Description: File type category ID from AssetFileAndLinkTypes mapping table (use ID, not name)

Validation.MmsIdRequired: At least one column must be mapped to MMS ID
Validation.RemoteUrlRequired: At least one column must be mapped to Remote URL
Validation.RequiredFieldValuesMissing: {field} is missing in {count} {count, plural, =1 {row} other {rows}} (rows: {rows}{truncated, select, true { …} other {}}). Please update the values before continuing.

UnchangedAssets.Title: Potential Unchanged Assets
UnchangedAssets.Subtitle: These assets may not have been modified by the import process
UnchangedAssets.Explanation: The following {count} {count, plural, =1 {asset was} other {assets were}} successfully processed, but the file list appears unchanged. This could indicate that the file already exists on the asset, was rejected due to duplicate URL, or another issue prevented the attachment.
UnchangedAssets.ActionNote: Review these assets manually in Esploro to confirm the file status. The provided URLs may already be attached or may have been rejected.

Step1.Title: Download MMS ID File
Step1.Description: Download the generated CSV file containing successful asset MMS IDs:

Step2.Title: Create Asset Set in Esploro
Step2.Description: Use the downloaded file to create a set of assets:
Step2.Item1: Navigate to Search & Browse > Advanced Search
Step2.Item4: Select "MMS ID" as the identifier type
Step2.Item5: Click "Create Set" and provide a meaningful name

Step3.Title: Run Import Asset Files Job
Step3.Item1: Go to Repository > Monitor Jobs > Run a Job
Step3.Item2: Find and select "Import Research Assets Files"
Step3.Item3: Choose the set created in the previous step
Step3.Item5: Submit the job and monitor progress

Step4.Title: Access Processed Files
Step4.Description: Once the job completes, access your files using these URLs:

Errors.FileTooLarge: File size must be less than 10MB
